name: Exa
description: Exa is a search engine that provides academic papers as search results.
recommendation: Exa is AI-based search engine, it has a free-tier plan that is sufficient for most use cases.

name: Crossref
description: Crossref is a DOI registration agency that provides access to academic papers and their metadata.
recommendation: Crossref is a simple search engine, it requires the project to have valid research questions.

name: DBLP
description: DBLP is a computer science bibliography that provides open bibliographic information on major computer science journals and proceedings.
recommendation: DBLP is a simple search engine, it mainly depends on keywords, project title is optional.

name: PLOS
description: PLOS provides open access to scientific articles and metadata via its public API.
recommendation: PLOS is a simple search engine, it mainly depends on keywords or queries, project title is optional.

name: OpenAlex
description: OpenAlex is a free, open catalog of the global research system, providing access to scholarly works, authors, institutions, and more.
recommendation: OpenAlex is a simple search engine, it mainly depends on keywords and queries, project title is optional.

name: EuropePMC
description: Europe PMC is a free database of life sciences and biomedical literature, providing access to articles, preprints, and more.
recommendation: Europe PMC mainly depends on keywords and queries, project title is optional.

name: CoreAPI
description: CORE provides access to millions of open access research papers from repositories and journals worldwide.
recommendation: CORE API requires an API key. It mainly depends on keywords and queries, project title is optional.

name: Elsevier
description: Elsevier provides access to scientific literature from ScienceDirect and Scopus via its APIs. Requires API key.
recommendation: Elsevier API requires an API key. It mainly depends on keywords and queries, project title is optional.

name: NCBI-NIH
description: NCBI/NIH E-utilities provide programmatic access to PubMed and other NCBI databases for literature and data retrieval.
recommendation: NCBI/NIH is for Medical research. It mainly depends on keywords and queries(API key is optional).

name: arXiv
description: arXiv is a free distribution service and an open-access archive for scholarly articles in the fields of physics, mathematics, computer science, quantitative biology, quantitative finance, statistics, electrical engineering and systems science, and economics.
recommendation: arXiv is a simple search engine, it mainly depends on keywords and queries, project title is optional. No API key required.

name: SemanticScholar
description: Semantic Scholar provides access to a large academic graph and scholarly papers via its public API.
recommendation: Semantic Scholar API provides rich metadata and is suitable for academic search and citation analysis. API key is recommended for higher rate limits. See https://www.semanticscholar.org/product/api/tutorial for details.
